VIII.iii.7.A.2.a
.
Definition:  Asbestos
Asbestos
is a fibrous form of silicate mineral of varied chemical composition and physical configuration, derived from serpentine and amphibole ore bodies.
Common materials that may contain asbestos include
steam pipes for heating units and boilers
ceiling tiles
roofing shingles
wallboard
fire-proofing materials, and
thermal insulation.
Note
:  Due to concerns about the safety of asbestos, the use of materials containing asbestos has declined in the U.S. since the 1970s.
